principles.name: Critical Thinking as Information Reception Plus Processing
principles.description: 'Critical thinking... is the ability to accept information and connect the dots for decision-making. So, what is really interesting about critical thinking is how you receive information is just as important as how you process it.'

principles.name: Filter-Driven Reality Distortion
principles.description: 'His filter was so pronounced that we could sit next to each other and hear someone speak, and we would hear things completely differently... his filter caused him to hear things that are always negatively and things that could always go wrong.'

principles.name: 80/20 Objective-Subjective Reception Ratio
principles.description: Optimal information reception is 'probably 80% objective and 20% subjective' - mostly accepting information as provided while maintaining some personal filter.

principles.name: Emotional Intelligence as Reception Foundation
principles.description: Good information receivers have 'a very strong emotional intelligence. So they're not reacting right away. They're willing to accept and process or hear it and process it before they accept it rather than just react.'

patterns.name: Information Reception Assessment
patterns.description: Evaluate how people receive information before assessing their processing abilities, looking for filters that distort input before analysis begins.
patterns.context: Hiring or team evaluation where decision-making quality depends on the ability to receive information accurately before processing it.

patterns.name: Process-Before-React Protocol
patterns.description: Practice receiving information, processing it internally, then responding rather than immediate reaction, requiring strong emotional intelligence to manage initial impulses.
patterns.context: High-stakes decision-making environments where immediate reactions can lead to poor choices based on filtered or emotionally distorted information.

examples.name: President with Negative Filter Example
examples.content: Dan worked with a company president whose 'filter is so pronounced that there's a filter embedded with this trepidation over anything new.' This caused them to 'hear things completely differently' when sitting together - the president's filter 'caused him to hear things that are always negatively and things that could always go wrong.' Result: 'in two years, he was president, he never made a good decision. He couldn't because he couldn't hear it.'

examples.name: Critical Thinking Definition and Reception Importance
examples.content: Dan defines critical thinking as 'the ability to accept information and connect the dots for decision-making' but emphasizes that 'how you receive information is just as important as how you process it.' Optimal reception is '80% objective and 20% subjective' with 'very strong emotional intelligence' to avoid immediate reactions.
